info.title: Voucherify API - Management
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details. - Endpoints tagged with 'Management'

post.description:
Creates a new project. You can add users, specify the cluster, timezone, currency, and other details.

All owners are added to the project by default.

200.description: Returns the details of a created project.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is missing required properties in the request.

value.details: Payload must have required property 'name'

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

403.description: Returns an error if the project is to be created in a cluster that is unavailable to the user.

value.details: Project is bound to different region

get.description:
Lists all projects for the organization.

The endpoint does not require any query parameters.

200.description: Returns the list of all projects with their details.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

200.description: Returns the details of a project.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_2F3txY7

put.description:
Updates an existing project.

You can add or modify settings for timezone, currency, notifications, and other details.

Only the fields sent in the request will be updated.

requestBody.description: Define the project details to be updated.

200.description: Returns the details of an updated project.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is invalid in the request.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_2F3txY7

delete.description:
Deletes an existing project.

The users currently using the deleted project will be automatically logged out.

> ðŸš§ Sandbox Project
>
>The sandbox project cannot be deleted.

204.description: Returns no content if deletion is successful.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_2F3txY7

post.description:
Assigns a user to a given project. The user must be an existing user in Voucherify.

> ðŸš§ Correct Use of Data
>
>To avoid errors, use the `"role"` key with either `"id"` or `"login"` keys.

200.description: Returns the details about the user assigned to the project.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload includes all three keys or the required data is missing.

value.details: Payload must have required property 'name'

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

delete.description: Unassigns the user from the project. If the user is currently logged in, they are automatically logged out. If the user is assigned to only one project, they cannot be unassigned from that project.

204.description: Returns no content if the user has been successfully unnassigned.

400.description: Returns an error if the user is not assigned to the project.

value.details: User is not assigned to the project

post.description:
Sends an invitation to an email address that has not been used yet as a Voucherify user login.

You can specify the projects to which the invited user will be assigned and define their roles.

requestBody.description: Defines the details of the invitation, the project, and roles to which the user will be assigned.

204.description: Returns no content if the invitation has been sent successfully.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload includes an incorrect role.

value.details: The role 'VICE_ADMIN' is incorrect

404.description: Returns an error if the project does not exist or has been deleted.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_4r3Ul0St

409.description: Returns an error if the email address belongs to a Voucherify user.

value.details: Duplicated user exists with email your.email@domain.com

get.description:
Lists all campaign templates available in the project.

> ðŸ‘ List Campaign Templates
>
> This endpoint works in the same way as the [List Campaign Templates endpoint](ref:list-campaign-templates).

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

parameters.name: starting_after_id
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. It retrieves the campaign templates created after a template with the given ID.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash - preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

parameters.name: include_total
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the response returns the number of all campaign templates, regardless of the applied filters or limits. Set to `false` by default.

200.description: Returns a dictionary of campaign template objects. The templates are returned by creation date by default. The most recent objects appear last unless specified otherwise with the `order` parameter.

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_5itvDU7

post.summary: Copy Campaign Template to a Project
post.description:
Copies a campaign template to another project.

The resources, like validation rules or products, will not be copied to the destination project yet. When the template is used to create a new campaign or add a new promotion tier, the resources will be created in the destination project.

> ðŸ“˜ Campaign Templates â€“ Documentation
>
>Read the [Campaign Templates documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/620-campaign-templates) to learn more about this feature.

requestBody.description: Determines the details about the template in the destination project as well as the destination project itself.

200.description: Returns the details about the copied campaign template.

value.name: Item_Discount_Campaign_Template
value.description: To be reused in the future

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_5itvDU7

409.description: Returns an error if a campaign template with the same name already exists.

value.details: Duplicated campaign_template exists with name Template copy

post.description:
Overwrites the default stacking rules.

If new stacking rules have been created for the project earlier (e.g. in the user interface), it returns an error. Use [Update stacking rules](ref:update-stacking-rules) endpoint to change the rules.

> ðŸ“˜ Stacking rules documentation
>
> Read [the Stacking rules article](https://support.voucherify.io/article/604-stacking-rules) to learn how they work.

200.description: Returns the details about the stacking rules assigned to the project.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload has incorrect values, e.g. integer limits.

value.details: Property .applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit must be <= 30

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find customer with id cust_xqA7DGj5eYPHg6PHVKwYRWiA

409.description: Returns an error if the stacking rules have been already created for the project.

value.details: Cannot exist more stacking rules for given project

get.description:
Lists all stacking rules.

Returns always a list with one item.

This endpoint can be used to retrieve the default stacking rules. The default stacking rules do not have an ID that could be used with the [Get Stacking Rules](ref:get-stacking-rules) or [Update Stacking Rules](ref:update-stacking-rules) endpoints.

> ðŸ“˜ Stacking Rules Documentation
>
> Read [the Stacking Rules article](https://support.voucherify.io/article/604-stacking-rules) to learn how they work.

200.description: Returns the details about the stacking rules assigned to the project. These can be either the default stacking rules or the created ones.

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_5itvDU7

> ðŸ“˜ Stacking Rules Documentation

put.description:
Updates the stacking rules.

Only the provided fields will be updated. However, if you update an array, the content of the array is overwritten. This means that if you want to add new values to an array and retain existing ones, you need to provide both the existing and new values in the request.

> ðŸ“˜ Stacking Rules Documentation
>
> Read [the Stacking Rules article](https://support.voucherify.io/article/604-stacking-rules) to learn how they work.

requestBody.description: Defines the stacking rules to be updated.

200.description: Returns the details about the updated stacking rules.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload includes incorrect details.

value.details: Property .redeemables_limit must be <= 30

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find stacking_rules with id stk_0d626410861700614

delete.description:
Deletes permanently the current settings for the stacking rules.

The stacking rules are restored to default values.

> ðŸ“˜ Stacking Rules Documentation
>
> Read [the Stacking Rules article](https://support.voucherify.io/article/604-stacking-rules) to learn how they work.

204.description: Returns no content if the stacking rules have been successfully deleted.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_5itvDU7

post.description:
Creates a new metadata (custom attribute) schema for a given resource.

The schema consists of a set of key-value pairs to customize Voucherify resources. 

You can nest your object within a standard metadata schema, e.g. within a campaign or customer schema. However, your nested object can't include another nested object. The standard metadata schemas are:
- Campaign
- Voucher
- Publication
- Redemption
- Product
- Customer
- Order
- Order line item
- Loyalty Tier
- Promotion Tier
- Earning rule
- Reward

Use this endpoint to define a metadata schema of a given resource for the first time. Once you configure a metadata schema for a given `related_object`, use the PUT [Update metadata schema](ref:update-metadata-schema) endpoint to either update or add new metadata key-value pairs. For example, use this endpoint to define a metadata schema for `related_object: campaign` for the first time. If you want define a new metadata property for `campaign`, use the [PUT Update metadata schema](ref:update-metadata-schema) endpoint.

> ðŸ“˜ Metadata Documentation
>
> Read [the Getting Started with Metadata](https://support.voucherify.io/article/99-schema-validation-metadata) and [Metadata Mapping](doc:metadata-mapping) articles to learn how metadata work in Voucherify.

200.description: Returns the details about the metadata schema.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload has incorrect values.

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_5itvmU7

409.description: Returns an error if the resource has a duplicate.

value.details: Duplicated metadata schema exists with related_object customer

get.description:
Retrieves a metadata schema.

> ðŸ“˜ Metadata Documentation
>
> Read [the Getting Started with Metadata](https://support.voucherify.io/article/99-schema-validation-metadata) and [Metadata Mapping](doc:metadata-mapping) articles to learn how metadata work in Voucherify.

200.description: Returns the metadata schema.

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_2F3txY7

put.description:
Updates a metadata schema.

With this request, you can:
- Add a nonexistent attribute definition to the metadata schema.
- Update an existing attribute definition by overwriting its current values.

In the request, you can provide only those definitions you want to add or update. Definitions omitted in the request remain unchanged.

However, if you want to update a definition, you will have to add all its current key-value pairs as well. Only the pairs sent in the request are saved for this definition. This means that the key-value pairs that are not sent in a request are restored to default values. For example, if your definition has an array with values and it is not sent in an update request, the array values will be deleted.

> ðŸ‘ Additional Notes
>
>- You cannot change the type of an existing schema, e.g. from `"string"` to `"number"`.
>
>- You can remove a definition with this endpoint by providing `"deleted": true` in the request. It will be moved to the Removed definitions section in the user interface. However, you cannot permanently remove a definition with this endpoint.

> ðŸ“˜ Metadata Documentation
>
> Read [the Getting Started with Metadata](https://support.voucherify.io/article/99-schema-validation-metadata) and [Metadata Mapping](doc:metadata-mapping) articles to learn how metadata work in Voucherify.

requestBody.description: Defines the metadata schema to be updated.

200.description: Returns the details about the updated metadata schema.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload includes incorrect details.

value.details: Property .properties.Size.eq.0 must be number

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_2F3txY7

delete.description:
Deletes permanently the metadata schema.

In standard metadata schemas, this endpoint removes permanently all definitions. The standard metadata schemas are:
- Campaign
- Voucher
- Publication
- Redemption
- Product
- Customer
- Order
- Order line item
- Loyalty Tier
- Promotion Tier
- Earning rule
- Reward

If you want to delete only one definition, use the [Update Metadata Schema](ref:update-metadata-schema) endpoint. In the request, provide the `"deleted": true` pair in the definition object. This definition will be moved to Removed definitions.

If you want to create a new standard metadata schema, use the [Create Metadata Schema](ref:create-metadata-schema) endpoint.

> ðŸš§ Metadata Purging
>
>This endpoint deletes permanently the metadata schemas only. However, it does not purge the metadata from associated entities, so the metadata added to those entities will remain.
>
>If you want to purge metadata from the entities:
>1. Remove all the definitions you want to purge. You can do this either in Voucherify Project Settings > Metadata Schema tab or with the [Update Metadata Schema](ref:update-metadata-schema) endpoint.
>2. In Voucherify Project Settings > Metadata Schema tab, go to the relevant metadata schema.
>3. In Removed definitions, click the bin button next to the definitions whose metadata you want to purge from entities.
>Note:
>- This is an asynchronous action. You will be notified when it has been completed.
>- You cannot purge metadata for the Redemption and Publication schemas.
>4. Use the Delete Metadata Schema request to delete the metadata schema from Voucherify.

> ðŸ“˜ Metadata Documentation
>
> Read [the Getting Started with Metadata](https://support.voucherify.io/article/99-schema-validation-metadata) and [Metadata Mapping](doc:metadata-mapping) articles to learn how metadata work in Voucherify.

204.description: Returns no content if the metadata schema has been successfully deleted.

401.description: Returns an error if an invalid token was provided.

402.description: Returns an error if the current plan does not include the Management API feature.

value.details: Your current plan does not include a feature required to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error when a resource could not be found.

value.details: Cannot find project with id proj_2F3txY7

put.description:
Updates a custom event schema.

With this request, you can:
- Add a nonexistent property to a custom event schema.
- Update an existing property.

In the request, you can provide only those properties you want to add or update. Definitions omitted in the request remain unchanged.

> ðŸ‘ Additional Notes
>
>- You can change the type of an existing property, e.g. from `"string"` to `"number"`.
>
>- You can remove a custom property with this endpoint by providing `"deleted": true` in the request. However, you cannot permanently remove an event definition or its property with this endpoint.

> ðŸ“˜ Custom Event Documentation
>
> Read [Custom Events](https://support.voucherify.io/article/111-custom-events) article to learn how custom events work in Voucherify.
>
>Read also the details about the [Track Custom Event](ref:track-custom-event) endpoint and the [Custom Event Object](ref:custom-event-object).

post.description:
Creates a new brand configuration.

You can have only one brand configured for a project.

> ðŸ“˜ White Labelling
>
> The white labelling settings which can be found in Project Settings > Brand Details and which are available only for Enterprise clients as a separate service can be configured only in the user interface.

Because a project can have only one brand, it always returns a list with one item.

This endpoint can be used to retrieve the brand configuration created with the Voucherify Dashboard and the ID.

case_sensitive_codes.description: Determines if the vouchers in the project will be case sensitive (if `true`, `C0dE-cfV` is not equal to `c0de-cfv`) or case insensitive (if false, `C0dE-cfV` is equal to `c0de-cfv`).

messages.description: Determines the notification settings for distributed messages according to the day and month limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon.

api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

bulk_api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for bulk API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

webhook_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for webhook calls made for the daily limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum four times a day.

cycle_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the billing cycle limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per the billing cycle.

cluster_id.description: The identifier of the cluster where the project will be created. The default cluster is `eu1` unless otherwise configured.

api_version.description: The API version used in the project. Currently, the default and only value is `v2018-08-01`.

users.description:
The users (their identifiers, logins, and roles) who will be assigned to the project. You can assign only existing Voucherify users.

It must be used either in the following combinations:
- `id` and `role`, or
- `login` and `role`.

items.title: Create Project Users
items.description:
Contains details about the users who will be assigned to the project.
Only the `id` and `role` or `login` and `role` should be provided in the request.

id.description:
The unique identifier of the user who will be assigned to the project. It can be found in Team Settings > Team > Edit member. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `login` string.

login.description:
The login data of the user who will be assigned to the project. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `id` string.

role.description:
The role of the user to be added. It can be one of the following predefined roles:
`ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`
or an ID of a custom role.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

resource_id.description: Unique resource ID that can be used in another endpoint to get more details.

error.description: Includes additional information about the error.

message.description: The message configured by the user in a validation rule.

messages.description: Determines the notification settings for distributed messages according to the day and month limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon.

api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

bulk_api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for bulk API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

webhook_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for webhook calls made for the daily limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum four times a day.

id.description:
The unique identifier of the user who will be assigned to the project. It can be found in Team Settings > Team > Edit member. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `login` string.

login.description:
The login data of the user who will be assigned to the project. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `id` string.

role.description:
The role of the user to be added. It can be one of the following predefined roles:
`ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`,
or an ID of a custom role.

ManagementProjectsUsersUpdateRoleRespons.description: Details about the user assigned to the project.

email.description: Email address to which the invitation will be sent. Must be a valid email address.

first_name.description: First name of the person who will receive the invitation. The name will be used in the user profile.

last_name.description: Last name of the person who will receive the invitation. The name will be used in the user profile.

projects.title: Project and Role
projects.description: In the key, provide the project ID to which the new user will be assigned. In the value, provide the role which the user will have in the project. The predefined Voucherify roles are: `ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`, `USER_RESTRICTED` (for the Areas and Stores, an Enterprise feature). Send a custom role ID (Enterprise feature) to assign a custom role. To find the custom role ID: If you are an admin, go to Voucherify Dashboard, Team settings, and Roles tab. Click on a custom role. The custom role ID is in the URL in the format `role_XyZ7aB9cD2eF4gH1iJ0kL5mN6oP8qR3s`.

additionalProperties.title: project_id
additionalProperties.description: Defines the project to which the user will be assigned and the role in the project.

conditions.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

ManagementProjectsTemplatesCampaignsList.title: Management Templates Campaign Template List Response Body

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about campaign templates.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of campaign templates.

data.description: Dictionary that contains an array of campaign templates.

total.description: Total number of templates, regardless of the applied query parameters. Displayed only if the `include_total` query paremeter is set to `true`.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request to get more records returned in the results.

more_starting_after.description: Returns an ID that can be used to return another page of results. Use the template ID in the `starting_after_id` query parameter to display another page of the results starting after the template with that ID.

ManagementProjectsTemplatesCampaignsCopy.title: Management Templates Campaign Copy Template Request Body

destination_project_id.description: Unique identifier of the project to which the campaign template will be copied.

ManagementProjectsTemplatesCampaignsCopy.title: Management Templates Campaign Template Copy Response Body

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the stacking rules in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of stacking rule objects.

data.description: Array of only one stacking rule object.

total.description: The total number of stacking rule objects. It is always 1.

related_object.description: The resource type. You can define custom metadata schemas, which have a custom `"related_object"` resource type, or you can use standard resource types: `"campaign"`, `"customer"`, `"earning_rule"`, `"loyalty_tier"`, `"order"`, `"order_item"`, `"product"`, `"promotion_tier"`, `"publication"`, `"redemption"`, `"reward"`, `"voucher"`.

allow_defined_only.description: Restricts the creation of metadata fields when set to `true`. In other words, it indicates whether or not you are allowed to create new metadata definitions; for example, in the campaign manager or publication manager. If it is set to true, then only the defined fields will be available for assigning values.

properties.description:
Contains metadata definitions. There can be many properties within this object.

Only the properties sent in the request will be created.

ManagementProjectsMetadataSchemasCreateR.title: Management Projects Metadata Schemas Update Response Body

ManagementProjectsMetadataSchemasListRes.description: Object containing a list of metadata schemas.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the metadata schemas in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of metadata schema objects.

data.description: Array of metadata schema objects. The metadata schemas are listed by related object properties.

total.description: The total number of metadata schema objects.

ManagementProjectsMetadataSchemasGetResp.title: Management Projects Metadata Schemas Get Response Body

allow_defined_only.description: Restricts the creation of metadata fields when set to `true`. In other words, it indicates whether or not you are allowed to create new metadata definitions; for example, in the campaign manager or publication manager. If it is set to true, then only the defined fields will be available for assigning values.

properties.description:
Contains metadata definitions. There can be many properties within this object.

Only the properties sent in the request will be updated. However, if you send a property, all its key-value pairs must be provided - otherwise, they will be overwritten to new values.

You cannot change the `"type"` property. However, it is required, so you need to add it to the request.

privacy_policy_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's privacy policy. It must be a valid URL format.

terms_of_use_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's terms of use.  It must be a valid URL format.

website_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's website. It must be a valid URL format.

state.description: Defines the brand's state or similar administrative area.

email.description: Defines the brand's email address. It must be a valid email format.

campaigns_overview_enabled.description: Enables the campaign overview for customers.

loyalty_enabled.description: Enables the loyalty campaign overview for customers.

gift_cards_enabled.description: Enables the gift card overview for customers.

coupons_enabled.description: Enables the discount coupon overview for customers.

referrals_enabled.description: Enables the referral campaign overview for customers.

theme.description: Determines the color scheme of the customer cockpit.

use_custom_double_opt_in_redirect_url.description: Enables the double opt-in option. It must be a valid URL format.

custom_double_opt_in_redirect_url.description: Defines the URL for the double opt-in consent. It must be a valid URL format.

description.description: A user-defined description of the project, e.g. its purpose, scope, region.

timezone.description: The time zone in which the project is established. It can be in the GMT format or in accordance with IANA time zone database.

currency.description: The currency used in the project. It is equal to a 3-letter ISO 4217 code.

dial_code.description: The country dial code for the project. It is equal to an ITU country code.

webhook_version.description: The webhook version used in the project.

client_trusted_domains.description: An array of URL addresses that allow client requests.

client_loyalty_events_enabled.description: Enables client-side events for loyalty and referral programs.

client_set_voucher_expiration_date_enabl.description: Enables client-side setting of voucher expiration date.

webhooks_callout_notifications.title: Webhook callout notification details
webhooks_callout_notifications.description: Determines the notification settings for webhook callouts configured in Distributions and Project settings.

distributions.description: Determines the notification settings for webhooks sent through Distributions.

email.description: Enables the notification through an email.

in_app.description: Enables the notification through an email.

emails.description: An array of email addresses which will receive the notification.

webhooks.description: Determines the notification settings for webhooks sent as set out in the Project settings.

email.description: Enables the notification through an email.

in_app.description: Enables the notification through an email.

emails.description: An array of email addresses which will receive the notification.

value.description: The percent value of the limit which, when reached, triggers the notification.

in_app.description: Enables the notification in the application.

emails.title: Email address
emails.description: An array of email addresses which will receive the notification.

redemptions.description: Determines the notification settings for redemptions. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon.

messages.description: Determines the notification settings for distributed messages according to the day and month limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon.

api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

bulk_api_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for bulk API calls made for the hourly limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per hour.

webhook_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for webhook calls made for the daily limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum four times a day.

cycle_calls.description: Determines the notification settings for API calls made for the billing cycle limit. The notification can be used as a warning that a limit will be reached soon. It is sent maximum once per the billing cycle.

cluster_id.description: The identifier of the cluster where the project will be created.

case_sensitive_codes.description:
Determines if the vouchers in the project will be:
- case sensitive - if `true`, `C0dE-cfV` is **not** equal to `c0de-cfv`),
- case insensitive - if `false`, `C0dE-cfV` is equal to `c0de-cfv`.

api_version.description: The API version used in the project. Currently, the default and only value is `v2018-08-01`.

is_sandbox.description: Determines if the project is a sandbox project.

ManagementProjectsAPIKeys.title: Project and Side Keys
ManagementProjectsAPIKeys.description: Returns `app_id` and `app_token` for the server-side and client-side authentication.

server_side_key.title: Server-side key
server_side_key.description: Contains the `app_id` and `app_token` to authenticate server-side requests.

app_id.title: Application ID
app_id.description: Application ID to be used as `X-App-Id` header in every HTTP request.

app_token.title: Application token
app_token.description:
Application token to be used as `X-App-Token` header in every HTTP request.

The application token (secret key) for the server-side authentication is visible in the Project Settings for 14 days when it is first generated in a newly-created project. Write your application token down and keep it in a safe place.

client_side_key.title: Client-side key
client_side_key.description: Contains the `app_id` and `app_token` to authenticate client-side requests.

app_id.title: Application ID
app_id.description: Application ID to be used as `X-App-Id` header in every HTTP request.

app_token.title: Application token
app_token.description:
Application token to be used as `X-App-Token` header in every HTTP request.

The application token (secret key) for the client-side authentication is visible in the Project Settings for 14 days when it is first generated in a newly-created project. Write your application token down and keep it in a safe place.

default_code_config.description: Determines the character set that is used as default for vouchers. It is affected by the `"case_sensitive_codes"` setting.

charset.description: Lists all characters that are used as default for vouchers

limits.description: Determines additional limits set on a given project, e.g. the Sandbox project. If no limits are returned, the limits set for the whole organization apply.

items.description: Determines the limit of API calls per given unit time.

value.description: Determines the maximum number of API calls per time set in `"duration"`.

duration.description: Determines the amount of time during which the calls up to the number specified in the `value` can be made. The duration is presented in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. `PT1H` means one hour.

value.description: Determines the maximum number of API calls per time set in `"duration"`.

duration.description: Determines the amount of time during which the calls up to the number specified in the `value` can be made. The duration is presented in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. `PT1H` means one hour.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user who has been assigned to the project.

login.description: The login data of the user who has been assigned to the project.

email.description: The email address of the user who has been assigned to the project.

first_name.description: The first name of the user who has been assigned to the project.

last_name.description: The last name of the user who has been assigned to the project.

projects.description: Lists key-value pairs, where the key is the project to which the user is assigned. The value is the role assigned in a given project. The predefined Voucherify roles are: `ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`, `USER_RESTRICTED` (for the Areas and Stores, an Enterprise feature).

additionalProperties.description: Returns the role the user has in the project.

is_owner.description: Determines if the user is the owner for the organization in Voucherify.

Junction.title: Junction
Junction.description: Logical Operator Between Filters. Filter by conditions set on the `junction` parameter indicating how the `conditions` should be accounted for in the query. An `AND` is an all-inclusive logical operator, meaning the `AND` operator displays a record if **ALL** the conditions separated by AND are TRUE, while  an `OR` operator displays a record if **ANY** of the conditions separated by OR is TRUE.

FilterConditionsString.title: Filter by conditions
FilterConditionsString.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

$not_contain.description: Value does NOT include the specified string.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign template was last updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

TemplatesCampaignsNameDescription.title: Update Campaign Template Request
TemplatesCampaignsNameDescription.description: Request body for updating a campaign template.

name.description: User-defined name of the campaign template. It must be unique.

description.description: User-defined description of the campaign template.

CampaignTemplateBase.title: Campaign Template Base
CampaignTemplateBase.description: Stores details about a campaign template.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign template. It is assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the campaign template.

description.description: User-defined description of the campaign template.

campaign_type.description: Type of the campaign used to create the campaign template. Templates created from a promotion tier are converted to `DISCOUNT_COUPONS`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign template was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

ManagementProjectsStackingRulesBase.description: Object representing basic stacking rule parameters.

exclusive_categories.description: Lists the IDs of exclusive categories. A redeemable from a campaign with an exclusive category is the only redeemable to be redeemed when applied with redeemables from other campaigns unless these campaigns are exclusive or joint.

joint_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the joint categories. A campaign with a joint category is always applied regardless of the exclusivity of other campaigns.

redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be sent in one request. Note: more redeemables means more processing time.

applicable_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `redeemables_limit`. For example, a user can select 30 discounts but only 5 will be applied to the order and the remaining will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_redeemables_per_category_limi.description: Defines how many redeemables with the same category can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_redeemables_limit`. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_per_cat.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit`.

discount_calculation_mode.description: Defines if the discounts are applied by taking into account the initial order amount or the discounted order amount.

initial_amount_mode_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the categories that apply a discount based on the initial amount.

discounted_amount_mode_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the categories that apply a discount based on the discounted amount.

redeemables_application_mode.description:
Defines the application mode for redeemables.
`"ALL"` means that all redeemables must be validated for the redemption to be successful.
`"PARTIAL"` means that only those redeemables that can be validated will be redeemed. The redeemables that fail validaton will be skipped.

redeemables_sorting_rule.description: Defines redeemables sorting rule. `CATEGORY_HIERARCHY` means that redeemables are applied oaccording to the category priority. `REQUESTED_ORDER` means that redeemables are applied in the sequence provided in the request.

redeemables_products_application_mode.description: Defines redeemables products application mode. `STACK` means that multiple discounts can be applied to a product. `ONCE` means that only one discount can be applied to the same product.

redeemables_no_effect_rule.description: Defines redeemables no effect rule. `REDEEM_ANYWAY` means that the redeemable will be redeemed regardless of any restrictions or conditions in place. `SKIP` means that the redeemable will be processed only when an applicable effect is calculated.

no_effect_skip_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are skipped even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `REDEEM_ANYWAY`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories`.

no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are redeemed anyway even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `SKIP`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_skip_categories`.

redeemables_rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values.

ManagementProjectsStackingRules.description: Object representing the details of the stacking rules.

id.description: The unique identifier of the stacking rules.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the stacking rules were created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the stacking rules were updated. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

ManagementProjectsMetadataSchemaDefiniti.title: Metadata Definitions
ManagementProjectsMetadataSchemaDefiniti.description: Custom definition name. This is also shown in **Project Settings** > **Metadata Schema** in the Voucherify Dashboard.

type.description: Indicates the type of metadata. Note that `"geopoint"` type is a paid feature.

optional.description: Indicates if this definition is optional or not for the resource.

array.description: Indicates if the definition is an array.

deleted.description: Indicates if the definition has been deleted from the schema.

object_type.description: The name of the custom resource (i.e. a nested object) if the resource has been previously defined. Otherwise, it is `null` for other types.

min_length.description: Value indicating the minimum length. Available only for the `string` type.

max_length.description: Value indicating the maximum length. Available only for the `string` type.

exact_length.description: Value indicating the exact length. Available only for the `string` type.

eq.description: Array of values that are allowed. Available only for the `string` and `number` types.

oneOf.title: Add number
oneOf.description: Adds numbers to the array. The value should be up to two decimal places.

ne.description: Array of values that are not allowed. Available only for the `number` type.

items.description: Adds number to the array. The value should be up to two decimal places.

lt.description: A property of the `number` type must have `less than` this value. The value should be up to two decimal places.

lte.description: A property of the `number` type must be `less than or equal` to this value. The value should be up to two decimal places.

gt.description: A property of `number` type must be `greater than` this value. The value should be up to two decimal places.

gte.description: A property of `number` type must be `greater than or equal` to this value. The value should be up to two decimal places.

id.description: Unique identifier of the metadata schema.

related_object.description: The resource type. You can define custom metadata schemas, which have a custom `"related_object"` resource type. The standard metadata schemas are: `"campaign"`, `"customer"`, `"earning_rule"`, `"loyalty_tier"`, `"order"`, `"order_item"`, `"product"`, `"promotion_tier"`, `"publication"`, `"redemption"`, `"reward"`, `"voucher"`.

allow_defined_only.description: Restricts the creation of metadata fields when set to `true`. It indicates whether or not you can create new metadata definitions, e.g. in the campaign or publication manager. If set to `true`, then only the defined fields are available for assigning values.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was updated. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the metadata schema.

ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchemaBase.title: Custom Event Schema
ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchemaBase.description: Object representing a custom event schema.

schema.description: Object containing custom event schema and its custom attributes (metadata).

type.description: Indicates the type of the custom event.

optional.description: Indicates if this property is optional or not for the resource.

deleted.description: Indicates if the property has been deleted from the schema. A deleted schema is inactive, but it can be restored.

ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchema.title: Management Projects Custom Event Schema
ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchema.description: Object containing the response to creating a custom event schema.

id.description: Unique identifier of the custom event schema.

name.title: Custom Event Name
name.description: User-defined name of the custom event. This is also shown in **Project Settings** > **Event Schema** in the Voucherify Dashboard.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the custom event schema was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the custom event schema was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

events.description: Lists the events that trigger webhook sendout.

active.description: Determines if the webhook configuration is active.

ManagementProjectsWebhook.title: Management Projects Webhook
ManagementProjectsWebhook.description: Response body schema for webhook endpoints.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the webhook configuration was created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique identifier of the brand configuration.

privacy_policy_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's privacy policy. It must be a valid URL format.

terms_of_use_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's terms of use.  It must be a valid URL format.

permission_reminder.description: Defines the message that is displayed to customers who opted in an email newsletter.

website_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's website. It must be a valid URL format.

state.description: Defines the brand's state or similar administrative area.

email.description: Defines the brand's email address. It must be a valid email format.

campaigns_overview_enabled.description: Enables the campaign overview for customers.

loyalty_enabled.description: Enables the loyalty campaign overview for customers.

gift_cards_enabled.description: Enables the gift card overview for customers.

coupons_enabled.description: Enables the discount coupon overview for customers.

referrals_enabled.description: Enables the referral campaign overview for customers.

theme.description: Determines the color scheme of the customer cockpit.

use_custom_double_opt_in_redirect_url.description: Enables the double opt-in option. It must be a valid URL format.

custom_double_opt_in_redirect_url.description: Defines the URL for the double opt-in consent. It must be a valid URL format.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of objects to be returned. The limit can range between 1 and 100 items. If no limit is set, it returns 10 items.
